instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> keyboard issue
threads.message:
I got this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> It was liquid damaged touch bar and keyboard not working but trackpad works. Found the logic board to be fine tested in another top case
So i replaced the touch bar and keyboard, touch bar now works but the keyboard does the exact same thing fans spin fast mac book runnings slow and no key responds.
Im wondering anyone come across this before? i have had a 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> track pad cable stop the keyboard working while the trackpad still worked i wondering if this is a similar situation?
I have tried replacing the key board cable to no avail.
Sorry for the long post hope someone could shed some light i know its possible its a bad keyboard but its strange its doing the same thing as the liquid damaged one.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> keyboard issue
threads.message:
Try another track?d cable.
Chinese cables are nightmare.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> keyboard issue
threads.message: HI mate the track cable is the genuine cable but i have ordered another track pad and cable to rule that out.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> keyboard issue
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> keyboard issue
threads.message:
Thanks yeah thats what i was thinking . I replaced track pad and cable from another machine and keyboard now works fine. Silly me probably did not even have to replace the keyboard oh well.
Probably was just the cable but i swapped them both track and cable at the moment
